nl.inl.blacklab.search.sequences

Class SpanQuerySequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.lucene.search.Query
      • org.apache.lucene.search.spans.SpanQuery
        • nl.inl.blacklab.search.lucene.SpanQueryBase
          • nl.inl.blacklab.search.sequences.SpanQuerySequence
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class SpanQuerySequence
extends SpanQueryBase
    Combines spans, keeping only combinations of hits that occur one after the other. The order is significant: a hit from the first span must be followed by a hit from the second. Note that this class is different from org.apache.lucene.search.spans.SpanNearQuery: it tries to make sure it generates *all* possible sequence matches. SpanNearQuery doesn't do this; once a hit is used in a SpanNearQuery match, it advances to the next hit. In the future, this class could be expanded to make the exact behaviour configurable: find all matches / find longest matches / find shortest matches / ... See SpanSequenceRaw for details on the matching process.
